issues.title: Missing Unaudited Actuals Financial Report Requirement
issues.description: California school districts are required to file an unaudited actuals financial report by September 15 each year. While the AR includes the annual statement of receipts and expenditures, it does not specifically address the comprehensive unaudited actuals report required by Education Code 42100, which must include detailed financial data in the format prescribed by the State Superintendent.

legal_citations.text: On or before September 15 of each year, each school district shall file with the county superintendent of schools a report of its financial condition showing receipts and expenditures for the preceding fiscal year in the form prescribed by the Superintendent of Public Instruction.

issues.required_language: The Superintendent or designee shall prepare and file with the County Superintendent of Schools an unaudited actuals financial report by September 15 of each year, showing the district's financial condition including all receipts and expenditures for the preceding fiscal year in the format prescribed by the State Superintendent of Public Instruction.

issues.title: Missing Gann Limit Compliance and Reporting Requirements
issues.description: While the AR mentions adopting an appropriations limit resolution, it lacks comprehensive procedures for calculating, monitoring, and reporting compliance with constitutional spending limits (Gann Limit) throughout the fiscal year, including required notifications when approaching limits.

legal_citations.citation: Education Code 42132, Article XIIIB California Constitution
legal_citations.text: The governing board shall adopt a resolution identifying the appropriations limit and shall establish procedures for monitoring compliance with constitutional spending limitations.

issues.required_language: The Superintendent or designee shall establish procedures to monitor compliance with constitutional appropriations limits throughout the fiscal year and shall notify the Board immediately if expenditures approach the established limit. The district shall maintain documentation supporting the calculation of appropriations limits and make such documentation available for public inspection.

issues.title: Missing Financial Emergency and State Intervention Procedures
issues.description: The policy mentions working with the County Superintendent when fiscal distress is predicted, but neither document contains specific procedures for state intervention scenarios, emergency apportionment processes, or the district's obligations when placed under state oversight.

legal_citations.text: Districts under state oversight must comply with specific reporting requirements and intervention procedures when facing fiscal emergency or insolvency.

issues.required_language: If the district receives a negative certification or is subject to state intervention, the Superintendent or designee shall comply with all additional reporting requirements and shall work with the assigned state administrator or fiscal advisor. The Board shall cooperate fully with state oversight procedures and implement all required corrective actions within specified timeframes.

issues.title: Outdated GASB References
issues.description: The AR references specific GASB statements that may be outdated (GASB 45 for OPEB reporting has been superseded by GASB 75). The regulation should reference current accounting standards or use more general language to avoid obsolescence.

legal_citations.text: Financial reports shall conform to generally accepted accounting principles and current governmental accounting standards.

issues.required_language: The Superintendent or designee shall ensure compliance with current Governmental Accounting Standards Board (GASB) requirements for post-employment benefits reporting and shall engage qualified actuarial services as required by applicable accounting standards.

issues.title: Missing Public Access and Transparency Provisions
issues.description: While the documents mention making reports available for public review, they lack specific procedures for ensuring public access to financial information, including website posting requirements and public notification procedures for financial reports.

legal_citations.citation: Government Code 6250 et seq., Education Code 35145
legal_citations.text: Public agencies must provide reasonable access to public records and financial information, including electronic access where feasible.

issues.required_language: The Superintendent or designee shall ensure that all required financial reports are made available to the public through the district website and at district offices. Public notification of the availability of major financial reports shall be provided through appropriate district communication channels.
